title: American_Top_40_1976_March_27th
description:
"And now, on with our survey of the 40 top hits in the nation. This is AT40, I'm Casey Kasem, and the countdown rolls on."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

Casey plays part of a song that sold a million copies 9 years before it appeared on the hot 100. The man who sang it hit the chart more times than anybody else, except Elvis Presley.

A listener wants to know, "Who is the all-time top British solo artist?" This artist has hit the top 40 seventeen times, had 13 top ten hits, and 5 number one songs as of this countdown.

There is a song by the first act on the legendary Motown label ever to sell a million singles (and Casey plays the song that did it as an extra).

Casey tells of Johnny Mercer, a man who wrote the lyrics for more than a thousand published songs; songs that have won him 2 Grammys, 4 Oscars, and 15 Oscar nominations. There is a disco version of one of his songs in this countdown.

Casey answers the question, "In what year did the most British acts hit number 1 on the American charts." He says it was the only year when the British acts held the top spot more weeks than the Americans did.

40: Bop - Ohio Players
39: Lorali - Styx
38: He's A Friend - Eddie Kendricks
37: Livin' For The Weekend - OJ's
36: I Do I Do I Do I Do I Do - ABBA
35: You Lose A Good Thing - Freddie Fender
34: Lookin' For Space - John Denver
33: Love Fire - Jigsaw
32: Inseparable - Natalie Cole

30: Only Love Is Real - Carole King
29: 50 Ways To Leave Your Lover - Paul Simon
28: Theme From "S.W.A.T." - Rhythm Heritage
27: Love Hurts - Nazareth
EXTRA: Shop Around - The Miracles
26: Good Hearted Woman - Waylon Jennings & Willie Nelson
25: Boogie Fever - The Sylvers
24: There's A Kind Of Hush - Herman's Hermits
23: Action - Sweet
22: Cupid - Tony Orlando & Dawn
21: Love Machine - The Miracles
20: Junk Food Junkie - Larry Gross
19: Tangerine - The Salsoul Orchestra

17: Bohemian Rhapsody - Queen

11: Golden Years - David Bowie
Extra: I Am, I Said - Neil Diamond
10: Money Honey - Bay City Rollers
9: Right Back Where We Started From - Maxine Nightengale
